707482f-a.text:
York Street, east from Pearl Street. Overhead is the Manhattan
Bridge.
March 9, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
707482f-a.folder: York St. & Pearl St., Brooklyn, NY

707481f-a.text:
York Street, north side, west from Pearl to Fulton Streets, showing in the backaround in order the Brooklyn Hridge approach and the Fulton Street Elevated line. At thhne N.N. corner of Washington and York Streets is the Gair Building. At the right partially seen in order are the Robert Gair Co. and the A & P Products Co. building; and the Interstate corrgated Hox Co. and
the American Tea Co. building.
Arril 4, 1938.
N. L. Sperr
707481f-a.folder: York St. & Pearl St., Brooklyn, NY

707483f-a.text:
York Street (left) at the N.W. corner of Pearl Street. Over-head is the approach to the Manhattan Bridge. In the background is the 13 story building housing the Robert Gair Co. and the A. & P. Products Co.
April 4, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
707483f-a.folder: York St. & Pearl St., Brooklyn, NY
